fields.name: Gal Gallop
fields.map_iframe: View Larger Map
fields.details: Don't have to be fast or able to run 20 miles for this one. Only requirement is to not be a guy! It's all about having fun in a supportive, non-competitive trail environment. Goes at the pace of the slowest runner -- beginner-friendly. Runs on the Kansas River "Sandrat" trails. Waterbottles or some sort of hydration system is required for the summer and headlamps are required for the winter!
fields.location: Meet in the trailhead parking lot just off 8th & Oak in north Lawrence.

fields.name: Beginner's Trail Run
fields.map_iframe: View Larger Map
fields.details: An easy-paced run of five miles or less on the Kansas River "Sandrat" trails. Bring a water bottle and a light. Good for veteran trail runners too, who just want to get some nice easy miles in.
fields.location: Meet in the trailhead parking lot just off 8th & Oak in north Lawrence.

fields.name: Humpday Run
fields.map_iframe: View Larger Map
fields.details: We will run about 4.5 to 12 miles on technical trail. Sometimes go out for dinner after. Don't forget to bring  water. When the days get shorter, in Fall and Winter, we'll need to bring lights, too. Run times and locations sometimes change on short notice. Always e-mail the run leader to check time and location before coming out for runs.
fields.location: Meet at the trailhead for the Clinton Lake North Shore Trail system. Just past the Corps of Engineers building. At the first parking lot on the right.

fields.name: Long Run
fields.map_iframe: View Larger Map
fields.details: L(ong) S(low) D(istance) - Normally do about 10 - 30 miles on technical trail, though there are plenty of turn-arounds if you want to go shorter.  Run times and locations sometimes change on short notice. Always e-mail the run leader to check time and location before coming out for runs.
fields.location: Meet at the Corps of Engineers parking lot, Clinton Lake north shore trail head

fields.name: Tuesday Tour de Stad
fields.map_iframe: View Tour De Stad in a larger map
fields.details: Warm up with 2-4 laps around the track. Then we will do “snakes” up & around each set of stairs on both the North and South stadiums. Completing all of the stairs on both the north and south stadiums equals one loop or set. Run up the stairs, and then walk or jog down to recover. You can do single steps up one stadium, and double steps up the other stadium to make it harder. There are other variations that we can add in. Cool down with a few laps around the track. Go at your own pace. If you feel dizzy, stop and rest. Waterbottles or some sort of hydration system are required!

fields.body: SATURDAY RUN CANCELED -- The Trail Hawks Saturday morning run is canceled Sept. 4 so as to not interfere with the Clinton Lake North Shore Trail Run. Visit www.psychowyco.com for details on the North Shore run. We'll pick up the Saturday Long Run on Sept. 11 (Patriot Day), with a run that uses Clinton Lake's red-, white- and blue-blazed trails.
fields.title: Saturday run canceled
